bio:treatment.discussion: The leaf structure of Botrychium paradoxum is uniform and unique. Very rare teratological individuals of other moonwort species may have trophophores partially or wholly transformed into sporophores.

Botrychium Ã— watertonense W.H. Wagner, known only from one locality in western Alberta, is the sterile hybrid of B . hesperium and B . paradoxum . It can be identified by its trophophore pinnae; all are bordered with sporangia. It may reproduce by some unknown mechanism, such as unreduced spores (W.H. Wagner Jr., F. S. Wagner, et al. 1984).
